1.text: Brethren, even if someone is caught in some fault, you who are spiritual must restore such a person in a spirit of gentleness. But watch out for yourself in order not to be tempted.

2.text: Bear each othersâ€™ burdens, and thus fulfill the law of Christ.

3.text: If anyone thinks that he is something when he is nothing, he deceives himself.

4.text: But let everyone test his own work: then one can take pride in himself, not by comparison with someone else.

5.text: Yes, each one will bear his own burden,

6.text: but everyone who is being taught in the word should share all good things with the one who teaches.

7.text: Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked; whatever someone sows is what he will reap.

8.text: Whoever sows to [the field of] self-indulgence will reap corruption from the flesh. But the one who sows to the Spirit will reap eternal life from the Spirit.

9.text: Let us not grow tired of doing what is good, for we will reap in due season, if we do not give up.

10.text: And so, as we have the opportunity, let us do good to all, especially to those who belong to the household of the faith.

11.text: See with what large letters I write to you with my own hand!

12.text: Those who desire to make a good showing in the flesh are trying to compel you to be circumcised, only so that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.

13.text: Even those who receive circumcision do not themselves keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised so that they may boast in your flesh.

14.text: As for me, I shall find glory in nothing, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.

15.text: In Christ Jesus, circumcision and uncircumcision mean nothing; only a new creation {matters}.

16.text: To those who live by this rule, may there be peace and mercy upon them, and on the Israel of God.

17.text: From now on, let no one cause me any trouble, for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus branded on my body.

18.text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brethren. Amen.
